main.name: Tony Chen
main.description: Here will be your description. Use this to describe what you do or whatever you feel best describes yourself to a potential employer
main.bio: I'm currently a full time student at Purdue University studying Computer Science with a concentration in Software Engineering. I specialize in front-end, mobile and iOS development and would love to work for a Formula 1 team or a car manufacturer one day. My passion for CS comes from it's versatility and because it provides the opportunity to create platforms to help others and make an impact on the world. I also enjoy the problem solving aspect of programming and the ability to express your creativity. In my down time, I like to organize hackathons, play Cities: Skylines, Apex Legends and make tiramisu!

resume.skillmessage: My track for Computer Science is Software Engineering, and I specialize in front-end development.

education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science

work.title: Software Engineer Intern
work.description: I worked within a team to develop several projects during my 6 months at the company. I thoroughly enjoyed the experience because it allowed me to apply my skills to real-life situations. One of the project I developed was used to combat COVID-19. The project received great feedback and is actively being used. Another side project I worked on required me to integrate two platforms within the company, and this project allowed me to get first-hand experience on an integration problem.

work.title: Undergraduate Researcher
work.description: I worked with the Slipchenko Lab Group at Purdue University to develop a user-friendly program -- iSpiEFP -- that performs LibEFP calculation for chemists. This is a unique experience because once iSpiEFP is finished, the entire chemistry community can benefit from this. Most of the chemists are unfamiliar with terminals, which is where LibEFP calculation is traditionally performed. Upon completing this project, numerous chemists will be able to use this robust calculation, which will save their time compared to their standard method.

work.title: Teaching Assistant
work.description: I have been a Teaching Assistant since my sophomore year. It is my favorite time and always the highlight of my week. I was a TA for 2 semesters for CS 240 (Programming in C) and have been a TA for CS 251 (Data Structures and Algorithms) since then. I led two labs each week to help students further their understanding by practicing what they learned in class or explain concepts in more detail for students who struggled in class. I also hold office hours which allows more one-on-one interaction with students who need guidance on homework and projects.

winningprojects.title: Composem
winningprojects.category: PickHacks 2021 1st place winner, and best fun hack. Composem provides an innovative cloud storage solution to turn a simplistic, accessible markdown syntax into sheet music.

winningprojects.title: C-City
winningprojects.category: BoilerMake 8 Winning Project. Web App my team built to recommend where people to move.

winningprojects.title: StarStats
winningprojects.category: Codepath Design Winning Project. An iOS app that display BrawlStar's user statistics.

winningprojects.title: No One Eats Alone
winningprojects.category: HelloWorld2k18 Winning Project. An iOS app that helps students plan events. This was my my first stab at iOS development and Hackathon!

projects.title: Ez-Prez: Presentation Generator
projects.category: BoilerMake 7 Project. iOS and Web app that converts text to a presentation using ML.

projects.title: Business Management
projects.category: A JavaFX with Sqlite3 application that track's a company's inventory.

projects.title: Circle
projects.category: A social media platform. The demo link works but it's a little slow, since it has to boot up.

projects.title: Flix
projects.category: An iOS app that displays the top movies from IMDB.

projects.title: Shell
projects.category: I created my own shell. Private repository, so no link.

projects.title: ANN
projects.category: I created an ANN network using tensorflow and basic algebra to recognize mnist_10 dataset.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
